In Lehigh County authorities released the disturbing details of a crime the district attorney calls repugnant A year old man is accused of targeting and sexually assaulting children at a daycare center in Whitehall Township Eyewitness News reporter Matt Petrillo is there And Matt that suspect was just arraigned this morning That s right he s charged with deviant sexual intercourse of a child Authorities tell us those assaults happened at this daycare behind me over several years Did Zimmerman work here No A woman who answers the door at a lot like home daycare near Allentown says year old Zachary Zimmerman did not work there before slamming the door We approve the charges But Lehigh County District Attorney Jim Martin says Zimmerman sexually assaulted three girls there Eyewitness News found the daycare is located at the home where Zimmerman lived Anytime a child is the victim of sexual assault it s repugnant it s unfortunate obviously and it s a crime Zimmerman faces deviant sexual intercourse with a child charges He allegedly assaulted three children over and over again from to But Zimmerman kept under the radar of Whitehall Township Police until this year when the victims came forward During one instance reported to police in July Victim disclosed that when she was approximately years old in Zachary Zimmerman kissed her on the mouth made victim one perform oral sex on him Victims came forward in July June and April Why were charges just filed Because there was an investigation Yeah we don t just file charges immediately We investigate And Zachary Zimmerman was arraigned this morning He was taken to the Lehigh County jail after not being able to post a bail Reporting live in Lehigh County Matt Petrillo CBS Eyewitness News All right Matt thank you

But into March I realized that locking down wasn t necessary In fact I was so naive at the time I had no idea I thought I would call a few people I had some connections with the medical community pretty extensive actually in my state And I thought I could call around and let people know like hey we ve got a strategy here It s not bad We can prophylax and we could use hydroxychloroquine as a first line therapy We don t need to lock down We can protect our elderly with prophylaxis really low doses and I actually thought that that was actually going to be well received Instead I was told to go home and to go home and don t use the personal protective equipment because I was just wasting resources And I literally was on the phone I won t say who it was but a fairly well high up person in our society in Texas on one of the boards And I told him I said how old are you He said I m something I said look I ve been through the AIDS epidemic okay we didn t know if we touched the patients what was going to happen and I go I ve been through another that pandemic itself was very eye opening for me I was very scared I was a young doc and I didn t go home I went to work I went to work I m going to see patients I told them right then I said look I don t mean to hurt your feelings but as far as I m concerned you re a coward you go home you go home I said I m not going home I m going to work I go I did I done six years in the ER hours a month I ve been on a bunch of trauma teams I m not going home I m going to see patients So that turned into short visits with some of my friends some of my patients who would call me knowing that I had talked to them about this disease And I ended up treating the disease And then I got on a Facebook Live video that in about two hours reached people And I saw it and I was like oh my God I m going to get some repercussions Sure enough I did The board came calling and they said you said that hydroxychloroquine works and you re basically a public menace And you know we want to know who you treated You said at the time It was really early on I said I d treat three patients And I had to provide all the records all the information I was very intimidated as you might imagine because you know I have to practice I have to feed my family I love what I m doing but you know I m not independently wealthy I was a little bit afraid I really was That lasted about a day at that point again as Dr Gold said we ve got to do the right thing for the patients At the time I wrote a bunch of letters saying I m not going to let my patients get on Vents and ECMO It s not going to happen I m not going to allow it to happen I m going to treat them I don t care Well suffice it to say I got reprimanded I m still in a process of negotiation with that whole thing But as Dr Armstrong said I m really not afraid I know I m doing the right thing I ve treated a number of patients I won t tell you how many because then I ll probably have to provide records for all that So for the purposes of this statement I m going to say I treated three Okay So the board is the fear of reprisal is the reason why we re in this place right now Docs don t want to do this There s a fear of reprisal I was very worried about it and I can tell you all the people who believe in this medication who believe in early treatment feel the same way They re really scared to go forward and treat patients because they don t want to lose their medical license and that s a big deal So the intimidation is Mr Jordan Thank you Mr Chairman Dr Fauci do protests increase the spread of the virus do protests increase the spread of the virus I think I can make a general statement Well half a million protesters on June alone I m just asking that number of people Does it increase the spread of the virus Crowding together particularly when you re not wearing a mask contributes to the spread of the virus Should we limit the protesting I m not sure what you mean How do we say limit the protesting Should government limit the protesting I don t think that s relevant to well you just said if it increases the spread of the virus I m just asking should we limit it well I m not in a position to determine what the government can do in a forceful way well you make all kinds of recommendations you make comments on dating on baseball on everything you can imagine I m just asking you just said protests increase the spread I m just asking you should we try to limit the protests I think I would leave that to people who have more of a position to do that I can tell you Government s stopping people from going to church Dr Fauci Yeah Last week in the Calvary Chapel case five liberals on the Supreme Court said it was okay for Nevada to limit church services I mean Justice Gorsuch said it best He said there s no world in which the Constitution permits Nevada to favor Caesar s Palace over Calvary Chapel I m just asking is there a world where the Constitution says you can favor one First Amendment liberty protesting over another practicing your faith I m not favoring anybody over anybody I m just making a statement that s a broad statement that avoid crowds of any type no matter where you are because that leads to the acquisition and transmission And I don t judge one crowd versus another crowd When you re in a crowd particularly if you re not wearing a mask that induces the spread It s a simple question doctor Should we limit the protests Government is obviously limiting people And look there s been no violence that I can see at church I haven t seen people during a church service go out and harm police officers or burn buildings But we know that I mean for days nine weeks it s been happening in Portland One night in Chicago officers were injured But no limit to protest But boy you can t go to church on Sunday I don t know how many times I can answer that I m not going to opine on limiting anything I m just going to tell you You ve opined on a lot of things Dr Fauci Yeah but I ve never said This is something that directly impacts the spread of the virus And I m asking your position on the protest Yeah well I m not going to opine on limiting anything I m telling you what it is the danger And you can make your own conclusion about that You should stay away from crowds no matter where the crowds are Government has stopped people from going to work In fact just in New Jersey four days ago Ian Smith Frank Trombetta were arrested for opening up for trying to operate their business their gym They were arrested But my bet is if these two individuals owned this gym were outside just in front of their gym and all the people who were working out in their gym were outside protesting they d been just fine But because they were in the gym working out actually running their business they got arrested Do you think that s okay You know I m not going to appoint on who gets arrested and who does not I mean you get where I m going I m telling you as a public health official I say crowds Do you see the inconsistency though Dr Fauci There s no inconsistency Congressman What There s no inconsistency So you re allowed to protest millions of people on one day in crowds yelling screaming but you try to run your business you get arrested And if you stood right outside of that same business and protested you wouldn t get arrested You don t see an inconsistency there I don t understand what you re asking me as a public health official to appoint on who should get arrested or not That s not my position You could ask me as much as you want and I m not going to answer it You ve advocated for certain businesses to be shut down I m just asking you on your position on the protest I mean I haven t seen one We ve heard a lot about hair salons I haven t seen one hairstylist who between haircuts goes out and attacks police or sets something on fire But we ve seen all kinds of that stuff during protests And we know the protests actually increased the spread of the virus You ve said that I said crowds I didn t say specifically I didn t say protests do anything So the protests don t increase the spread of the virus I didn t say that You re putting words in my mouth No I just want an answer to the question Do the protests increase the spread of the virus I don t have any scientific evidence on anything I can tell you that crowds are known particularly when you don t have a mask to increase the acquisition and transmission So you don t have a position on whether the protests increase the spread of the virus or don t increase the spread of the virus I m saying that crowds wherever the crowds are can give you an increased probability that there s going to be acquisition and transmission But do you understand Americans concern Protesting particularly according to the Democrats is just fine but you can t go to work you can t go to school you can t go to church There s limits placed on all three of those fundamental activities First Amendment activities but protesting is just fine You know the gentleman s time has expired but I ll just ask the gentleman to just think about his question and put it in reference to crowds that gather in political meetings at fundraisers without masks on an oil rig in Texas nobody wearing a mask nobody social distancing but a fundraiser Would that be problematic With that I ll yield five minutes to Mr Fox
PYM JBZ

There s more trouble at a Brighton school which attracted worldwide attention after the Egg Boy attack Seven News has learnt the headmaster there is now under fire for using a racist slur at a school assembly Words are a matter of principle for this Brighton College educator We re looking for not just what has been communicated but how it s been communicated But his words have landed him in hot water using a racist slur not once but three times at school assembly Mission Brown Paint was originally called N Brown Paint Oh yeah it was Richard Minnock used the N word in the wake of the Christchurch terror attack to highlight insidious racism So Mission Brown Paint is only a tiny step in language away from N Brown Paint I m sorry students were there including the boy who egged Senator Fraser Anning Many gasped in shock You can t say that in front of a school especially a school as multicultural as ours Mr Minak later emailed students to apologise and explain I hope you understand that I used it to call out and criticise racism and bigotry Sometimes we have to use offensive words to explain why they are offensive But now the slur is being used in the playground I think their theory behind it is if the principal can say it why can t we Late today the Education Department told News Principal Minak should not have used what they called the offensive word A spokesperson says he will now be reminded by the department to use appropriate language Mike

The Quran Revealed The Quran Revealed Today we are going to be looking at one of the justifications given for Muhammad s marriage to six year old Aisha Let s go ahead and watch the video Now let us look at the fruit that came from the tree so we can understand it Who was Aisha She is the woman that memorized the Quran When the Quran was revealed When the last ayats of the Quran The last ayats were revealed Three months later Aisha had memorized the whole Quran Think about that Secondly let s look at Aisha Because she lived with the Prophet She saw him She understood him Intimately clearly Her mind was bright and she was a powerful young girl a very aggressive young girl powerful aggressive and deep and intelligent memorized the whole Quran and guess what She was holding with her when the Prophet passed away at least ahadith that nobody else knew And that s why after Abu Hurairah nobody related to us more hadith than Aisha So the justification given for Muhammad s marriage to a child is that Aisha was able to memorize the Quran within a matter of months and also that because she knew the Prophet so intimately she was able to provide many of the hadith that are now used to assist Muslims in determining how to live their lives in a way that is pleasing to Allah However is this sufficient justification for Muhammad marrying a child and making child marriage a part of the Islamic religion Was there no other way that the Quran could be recorded or the Hadith collected And of course the obvious answer is no There are many different ways that the Quran could have been recorded and preserved that did not involve child marriage For example Allah could have simply invented a pen given one of his followers some paper and taught them how to read and write In my opinion that would have been a much more moral way to preserve the Quran But let me know what you think in the comment section If you like this video hit the like button subscribe hit the notification button and I ll see you in the next video where I ll be giving a slightly more serious and in depth analysis of another of the justifications of child marriage in the Islamic religion

First seeing Laura what you re seeing behind me is one of multiple locations that have been burning in Kenosha Wisconsin over the course of the night A second night since Jacob Blake was seen shot in the back seven times by a police officer And what you are seeing now these images came and come in stark contrast to what we saw over the course of the daytime hours in Kenosha and into the early evening which were largely peaceful demonstrations in the face of law enforcement It wasn t until night fell that things began to get a little bit more contentious Things were thrown back and forth Police started using some of those crowd dispersal tactics like tear gas even playing very loud sounds to push them out And then what you are seeing the common theme that ties all of this together is an expression of anger and frustration over what people feel like has become an all too familiar story playing out in places from across the country not just here in Kenosha Wisconsin Christine Laura All right thank you so much for that

Yeah impossible being the key word there because we ve been pressing police but they won t come out and explicitly say whether or not they believe this guy did this himself We did uncover some do some digging tonight though when we found out that he actually he works with paint for a living but there s just no painting over this one He s spending the night in jail Ugly words spray painted on a South Haven family s vehicles February th and now possibly an ugly and unexpected explanation for them That it was a hoax just kind of made us look silly Friday morning police arrested Trumaine Foster an African American man and the owner of this slur covered truck who in an ironic twist is listed as white in the DeSoto County jail system He s charged with insurance fraud and tampering with evidence leading some to ask Did he stage this thing The N words and Trump reference have since been removed but this is one of the spray painted cars We saw a woman driving off it not answering questions questions Why would he do this To make something up that just does not make sense to me Investigators may be thinking Foster s line of work could shed light on this We ve learned he owns this body shop in Olive Branch Multiple people in the automotive community tell us he specializes in painting cars I didn t even know he painted cars for a living One person tells us He even painted his wife s car after it was sprayed with racist graffiti Okay well I mean that s just embarrassing It s absolutely embarrassing Foster s neighbors in the Lakes of Nicholas subdivision hate to think the worst because the spray paint left more than ugly words It left an ugly stain an entire community wasted no time erasing In the silver lining of it it was nice to see a neighborhood come together for one of our neighbors And in just the last two hours Foster had to pose for another mugshot this time wearing a yellow jail uniform No bond s been set for him but he does have a court date That s going to be on Wednesday For now we re live in Hernando Luke Jones WREG News Channel

Well here we go again First I remember a long time ago it feels like now when we were still talking about lockdowns and all that I first covered the case of Ahmaud Arbery who was a black supposed jogger you know just going for a jog in the neighborhood that was gunned down by some virulent Klansmen Or so the official narrative went at the time and it was funny how that whole thing unfolded And then we got the George Floyd thing which unlike the Ahmaud Arbery thing had a pretty universal agreement of people saying hey what he was using a counterfeit bill He might not have even known it was counterfeit and then he ends up dead Knee on his neck for three minutes after he s passed out Everybody pretty much agreed at the time that hey bad situation then we get all these riots and things and then you know the media is telling us that oh well the riots aren t a part of the peaceful protest you have to separate them which you know is nonsense they would never do that for for any right wing group if there was any violence there was one person you know who even said a mean word at a journalist uh the whole uh protest would be condemned as violent by the press but here we have rioters um you know not only uh shouting mean things at CNN but actually beating up CNN employees and even going to CNN headquarters in Atlanta and trying to burn it down before being you know stopped by the police And then eventually it felt like this week or last week it felt like you know things were starting to calm down that there wasn t as much violence going on and that there was just more it was more of the aftermath people still talking about you know how cops are bad and stuff Oh and then we had the Chaz the Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone wasn t that fun And so I felt like we were moving on And then all of a sudden on Friday night all hell breaks loose when an Atlanta cop kills some black eyed Wendy s And apparently this was some guy who was drunk going through the drive thru and passed out while he was waiting for his food and so the Wendy s called the cops to wake him up and get him out of there and of course they had him take a breathalyzer which from what I understand the smart thing to do is if a cop offers you a breathalyzer you want to turn it down and just go to the station and get arrested which sounds counterintuitive but that s what I ve heard is the better legal thing to do because maybe then they do a full toxicology report and there s a margin of error there s more error when it comes to the breathalyzer I think so if you re on the edge um you know it might register you as over the legal limit when you re not um but this guy apparently had a uh was like times the legal limit so he was not really on the margin so probably wouldn t have helped him just to decide to get arrested and not take the breathalyzer but either way it was very clear his goal was to not get arrested because once he took the breathalyzer it was clear that he was you know heavily intoxicated although So I mean he seemed probably not okay to drive but he wasn t falling all over himself drunk when he was talking on the body cam footage But you know what ended up happening was the cops decided okay you re drunk so we have to arrest you for DUI because you were in the driver s seat of your car You were driving through the Wendy s drive thru so you re getting a DUI And the guy resisted and grabbed the taser and ran off and that s when things become a little murky because we don t have the best video at least that I haven t seen yet We have one video where they run off screen and you can t see them and then you hear the gunshots And then there s another one which captures the full scene from the Wendy s surveillance And in that one I mean it looks to me actually in the first video it looked to me like the cop at first did not pull out his gun He pulled out his own taser because I think Richard Brooks was his name grabbed the taser from the other officer Because I see the officer chasing Brooks pull out something that looks yellow and it fires what looks like the darts with the wires attached to it that the police tasers have the kind that sort of hook into your skin and then they zap you Well my guess is he must have missed Brooks because Brooks keeps running and then he turns around and points the taser at the cops At least that s what it looks like We can t see exactly but that s what the police are saying and the video seems to confirm at least something like that happened And then the cop pulls out his gun and shoots him Now in ordinary times when there s not a lot of tension over this sort of thing this probably might generate some angst amongst locals but this wouldn t be a national story I mean you have a guy who had a DUI resisting arrest and then stole a taser and tried to use it on the cops and he got shot and oops he died at the hospital But with all this going on you had to know that the first response to all this is that people are going to immediately think that this is totally unjustified in every way I mean looking at the video do I really think that it was a great idea to shoot the guy Well it s hard because I think of it from the perspective of an ordinary American and I know that as an ordinary American who s not a police officer I would get charged for murder unless I shoot someone who s actively attacking me If someone s in retreat and they re running away from me and I shoot them in the back then I m going to jail And now police I understand are not trained that way because they re trained to hunt people down The job of a cop is to arrest people who are suspected criminals And so can I say that in principle given what his job description is that he did anything wrong No I just think that he did something that was very dumb in our current context I mean if I were a cop right now I would not be I would look at every time I pull out my gun that I m sticking my neck out there and that I am the one under threat Unless I m being directly attacked by somebody But if you re a cop and you re using your gun in an offensive way you are going to be in a pretty bad predicament You re going to be held to a very high standard A standard dare I say it almost as high as an ordinary American So if I were in this guy s position I d look at it as oh okay guy in the Wendy s parking lot had a DUI He s running away I m not going to shoot him because I don t want to put my you know put my livelihood at risk that s the way I would look at it now you might say oh well he had the police taser you know he s a threat he s running away he s drunk he could go out and hurt somebody that may be the case but if I m in that cop s shoes I m not taking the risk my advice to all cops out there is just do everything you can not to shoot someone I understand that you know this guy already fired his taser and so the tasers are kind of one shot deals if you miss with the taser there I believe the training is you switch to the gun because that s your last resort to try and subdue a suspect But if it s a situation like this where it s something like DUI which is a real crime I don t think that DUI should be legalized or something like that This isn t something as BS as peddling a counterfeit bill Driving while times over the legal limit with blood alcohol content is dangerous because you can kill somebody on the road There s other drivers on the road I m not saying that DUI is okay But when you re under so much scrutiny I just don t see the point in trying to hunt down every last perp Cops right now really the best thing they can do is the bare minimum that they have to do The less cops are noticed right now the better off that they will be because in every one of these situations the mob is going to side with whoever gets killed because they re already whipped up into that frenzy of the police is just killing innocent people So when the cops kill somebody like this they re going to give the suspect the benefit of the doubt Much in the same way that a lot of people would tend to believe that suspects who get caught up in bad times with the police had it coming the attitude right now with a lot of folks is that the police are the ones who are always up to no good and they kind of have it coming So what sort of rioting did we get last night in response to all this Well they burned down the Wendy s for no apparent reason All day they were not letting people go to the Wendy s If anyone tried to pull in the parking lot they were blocked by the mob shouted down and they hurled epithets at them telling them hey go get a burger at a black owned business which if you re driving down the road and you re just looking for some fast food I don t know which one is owned by a black person or not I mean for all I know that Wendy s could have been owned by a black franchisee But the protesters I guess since they re maybe too afraid to directly attack the police and go burn down the police precinct like what happened in Minneapolis They just decided to blame everything on Wendy s because Wendy s happened to be where this guy got killed And the police of course did not protect the Wendy s The Wendy s was burned to the ground Now CNN I have to give them some credit was trying to document this And the rioters beat up CNN and smashed their camera They do not like CNN But CNN still called them protesters and said well the protesters didn t like us filming their protest Oh my god It s just it s completely unbearable I mean how much more cucked can you be that when your own guys are getting beat up by these rioters you still refuse to call them out and call them rioters You still are carrying water for these people who detest you on the most basic level They hate you just as much if not more than the average Fox News viewer And then in addition to burning down the Wendy s they decided to shut down I which I m sure is quite scary because if you re going through there and you happen to be in the line of cars that get stopped what happens a lot of times is the mob will come up and just start smashing all the cars on the highway That s their way of protesting is they jump in front of these people make them stop and then they smash their cars and graffiti them and things Now I haven t seen any evidence of this happening in this case but that s my first thought If I m one of those cars that gets stopped you re scared to death Imagine if you have kids in the car because this has happened in other cities When they shut down the highways they go and just beat on cars and things It s frightening And of course if you don t have a lot of money and your car gets totaled by a mob you re kind of screwed But this isn t how the mob thinks The mob wants to say that everybody s responsible for the actions of individual police officers or whatever I mean the comments on Twitter of course are absolutely disgusting when you see this kind of violence People are going it s like well are you saying that a Wendy s is more valuable than Black Lives It s like shut up I have no patience left for these people As Hans Hoppe said crush the anti fascist mob That s how I feel the more I look at this stuff At first because remember I m one of these people who s rather critical of the police state and of government tyranny and all these things but these people are deranged And don t twist that into meaning a racial thing I ve been very clear from the beginning that I think that this is a whole left wing movement I mean just look at the Chazz I mean do you think that there s too many black people in the Chazz but of course with Atlanta you re going to get a lot more black people but this is not something that has to do with skin color and neither frankly does the policing thing I ve explained so many times why I just detest the racialist argument about crime and about policing and I ve explained the statistics because there s this thing called multivariate analysis you might not have heard of it but just because there is a correlation between two things doesn t mean that there s a direct causation Just because the number of black people killed by cops as a percentage of their population is higher than whites even though the absolute number is still much lower that does not mean that cops are just going out and looking to kill black people because they re black There are other variables you have to control for like poverty and whether they live in high crime areas or not And of course poverty tends to determine whether or not you live in a high crime area If you re LeBron James you re not going to live in a high crime area and you re probably not going to have too many terrible interactions with the police But these arguments have been made so many times and time and time again that if you haven t gotten through to people at this point you re not going to get through to them They believe what they want to believe and they re going to blame who they want to blame And you know they re not even just blaming the police They re blaming all white people and demanding that I and other people who don t have enough melanin in our skin bow down to those who do have enough melanin Now I don t know exactly where the line is You know you look at guys like Barack Obama He s pretty pale for a supposedly black man You know what s the rule Is having one black grandparent maybe make you a black person We could use the same rules the Nazis used for the Jews Or are we going to use the one drop rule from the Old South to where if you had one drop of black blood well then you re a black person The racial theorists on the left I don t think have thought this out so much Now I guess a lot of the right wing racists have and they probably have their own rules but I don t read them because they re not relevant Despite what the rioters might tell us and what their apologists on Twitter might say these phantom white supremacists just aren t anywhere I ve never met any of them Right wing racism is about the most marginalized idea in America Left wing racism on the other hand is exalted and in fact those who do not endorse left wing racism and practice it openly are condemned themselves as evil racists It s quite ironic So I suspect that the killing of this Richard Brooks character is going to reinvigorate things and I do feel bad for him and his family I don t think that he should have died I mean obviously the man was intoxicated so he wasn t making the best decisions He was very drunk And I would like to think that there was a way that they could have gone about things that did not result in his death But either way at this point there s much bigger issues on the table than just his death It s the cohesion and the collapse of our society So with that said if you gained anything of value out of this video I d appreciate you clicking that like button and sharing this video And if you haven t already please do subscribe because I do upload every day and I d hate to have you miss one So I ll see folks back here tomorrow

Tonight at he is one of the most outspoken critics of police use of force here in the Valley But he gets some on the job training about use of force tonight Very interesting stuff Reverend Jarrett Maupin led protests and marches after Phoenix police shot and killed an unarmed man Well tonight he gets a chance to experience the split second decisions that police have to make when encountering a suspect And our Troy Hayden was right along with him tonight getting the training as well This must have been eye opening It was It was a really interesting experience We ve all watched those protests all over the country after police officers were accused of shooting people who aren t armed But what would happen if one of those protesters felt what it was like to wear a badge and then be put in a life or death situation himself So I m going to have you put the holster on right inside your belt loop there Jarrett Maupin gets his weapon You might recognize him as a high profile organizer in the minority community Just last month he led marches on Phoenix Police Headquarters after an officer shot an unarmed man We want his badge We want his gun We want his job Today he accepted an invitation to look at things from the other side agreeing to go through a force on force training session with the Maricopa County Sheriff s Office Three scenarios where you have to decide to shoot or not shoot Scenario one is a call about a man casing cars in a parking lot Maupin approaches the man and starts asking questions Look You re looking for your vehicle What kind of car do you drive What kind of car do you drive This is my car man Moppen the officer is shot It happens that fast At what time did you think that it was time for you to address the use of force that was given When he came to the back of the vehicle and was hiding you know I could sense something was wrong Scenario two a call of two men fighting What s going on today gentlemen What s going on today gentlemen What are you doing What s happening here What s wrong with you Back out Huh What are you doing man Hey Hey he shouldn t approach me He shouldn t approach me He shouldn t approach me He shouldn t approach me What happened in there Yeah What are you doing You just shot him Hey he rushed me Tell me why you shot him Well I shot because he was within that zone You know I felt there was an imminent threat I didn t necessarily see him armed but he came clearly to do some harm to the officer to my person It s hard to make that call It shakes you up Again an unarmed man was shot Scenario three a call about a possible burglar walking down the street Maupin gets him on the ground He s not complying I need you to keep your hands up sir For what Because I need to check that waistband For what What are you doing because I don t know what you have under there Hey everybody look at this guy What are you doing No shots fired but the suspect did have a hidden knife in his waistband I went through the scenarios too without seeing what Maupin did Do you have keys or do you have anything you can show me that No I need to talk to you Come on out over here Well I m dead Maricopa County sheriffs get on the ground Get on the ground Both of you get on the ground Get on the ground For what Get back Get back Same results for both of us Things happen very fast out here I asked Maupin what his biggest takeaway from this exercise will be I didn t understand how important compliance was But after going through this yeah my attitude has changed This is all unfolding in to seconds People need to comply with the orders of law enforcement officers for their own sake Thanks to the Maricopa County Sheriff s Office for taking us through that today It was an eye opener That s a tremendous admission that Reverend Maupin just made Right You need to comply for your own safety Right and he saw it I mean he plainly shot a man who was not armed but was coming at him and he felt that he was unsafe at that point He was coming after him and he fired Yeah and I don t think any officer goes into work thinking I m going to shoot and kill somebody today But these interesting things happen like the guy coming from behind the SUV boom and you re done You are How did you feel about those scenarios when you were going through them Did it change your perspective Yeah I ve been through one of these before about four or five years ago but it just reinforced how fast things happen And you think at the time oh I can think through this and I can figure this all out No it s boom It s just there It s that fast I have a lot of respect for Maupin for going through that Yeah I agree And agreeing to go through that and seeing it from the other side as well Do you think it changes the way he approaches these issues going forward He says he s going to go out into the community and say what he said at the very end there You have to comply with what police officers tell you Let everything sort out at the end but just do what they tell you right then and sort things out afterward Interesting All right Thanks Troy Good stuff Troy Thank you
Thank you

Brent and Jen Yukon police say after investigating the incident surrounding that video two male students are now facing charges But the NAACP chapter here at Yukon says it s still on high alert This video has gone viral but for all the wrong reasons It shows three men walking through the parking lot of the Charter Oak Apartments yelling the N word Yukon police announcing tonight the arrest of two male students as a result year old Jared Corral and year old Ryan Mukash both scheduled to appear in Rockville Superior Court next Wednesday Police say a third male seen in the video did not participate UConn s NAACP chapter says they won t stand for such behavior The chapter held a town hall on campus Monday night focusing on a list of demands they want to see from the University We want to see more diversity amongst the faculty We want to see the university answer incidents of racism with more promptness Although arrests have been made students say if the university does not take further action their silence will create a culture in which racism is tolerated It s good because it sets an example for everyone on the UConn campus that there are repercussions for your actions and that actions need to be taken in order to show that there s change being made Tonight s town hall just one of many measures students are taking after the video surfaced Just hours before hundreds rallied on campus marching to oppose racism in all forms New UConn President Thomas Katsalais taking the bullhorn If you re not for equality and respect then I m not for you I didn t think it was going to happen so fast and I think that the gathering today did help I don t think there was a sense of urgency before I also would just like to see more care from the whole entire student body And President Casaleas releasing a statement just a short time ago saying it is supportive of our core values to pursue accountability through due process for an assault on our community that has caused considerable harm I m grateful for the university s collective effort in responding to this incident especially the hard work of the UConn Police Department which has been investigating the case since it was reported For now live in stores Nia Maldonado Fox News Thank you

Welcome to Wallace

Yesterday Manitoba set a single day record of new COVID cases with Dr Brent Roosin hinting at more restrictions to flatten the curve And as Manitoba looks into an uncertain next few weeks we re turning now to one of our province s former chief public health officers for his insights into the virus and how to handle it Joining me now is Dr Joel Kettner now an associate professor at the University of Manitoba s College of Medicine Good morning to you Dr Kettner Good morning So as mentioned you served as Manitoba s Chief Medical Officer of Health from to During your tenure you dealt with concerns about viral outbreaks but really not on this level That s true In fact you could say we had a pandemic every year with influenza It meets the criteria for a pandemic But right now we re using this term in quite a different way and even the pandemic of H N influenza or other similar kinds of challenges that got our attention like SARS and at one point Middle East Respiratory Syndrome which are both coronaviruses There s never been really a response to a respiratory virus like we re seeing now around the world and in Manitoba I mean sometimes we talk about the virus causing all of these problems but we have to also think of the response to the virus which is causing quite a bit of issues too So I just want to put in a couple of quick caveats You know I m not criticizing government decisions or our public health leaders They have a lot more information about what s going on than I do So I have to be respectful and humble about that And I m also not recommending that people should reject or not follow the directives or advice But I do have questions about the policies and the attempts that are being used not just in Manitoba but elsewhere to try to interrupt the spread of this virus or control its impacts So what are some of your questions and concerns Dr Kettner obviously we ve had restrictions we ve had lockdowns in the past and we could be facing more restrictions going forward So what are kind of your main concerns Well in public health we have to look at the big picture and we have to think about not just one disease but all diseases and injuries and causes of morbidity and mortality and we have to also think about the impacts of our interventions the side effects we call them in medicine but the harms of interventions and I think we re learning more about what those harms are and how they re maybe unfairly distributed and affecting people differently based on you know single parents people working for hourly wages small in enterprises which are closing big effect on the on the economy and our deficit of government impacts on education I mean we re learning more and more about what those harmful impacts are so what s the benefit well the benefit is as we know to try to flatten the curve In other words to try to prevent our hospitals being overrun with cases and to try to reduce the mortality especially premature mortality How much benefit do these lockdowns and restrictions have No doubt they have some impact But we have to put this in perspective So here s a few numbers which I think your listeners might find interesting and important cases in Manitoba That represents less than of our population that s one in the people so far have have had a positive test result deaths that s one per manitobans one in manitobans have died that s less than one percent of all deaths in other words less than one percent of all causes of death icu admissions that s about percent of our icu beds in a typical flu season the majority of icu beds are taken up by people with a variety of viral and bacterial causes of acute lung injury or pneumonia And we so far from estimates from descriptions of our capacity for ventilators we re using up less than of our ventilator capacity So Dr Kettner what do you I want to add one more point Oh sorry hospitalizations that s less than of all our beds So we just have to put into perspective the impact that this disease is having and and on the one hand and of course one other very important point about this disease it s primarily affecting older people of our deaths in Canada are in people over the age of and in and residents of personal care homes okay doctor Kettner I m so sorry

Here s Baltimore City Schools dealt with a teacher attrition problem In the last three years alone more than have voluntarily left WMAR News investigative reporter Skylar Henry sat down with leaders in the school system trying to figure out why it s been happening at such a rapid rate They were painting it to look like a mountain Baltimore City Schools has a problem School CEO Dr Sonia Zangelis won t deny it and she s trying to get ahead of it It s a mass exodus of teachers Is that interruption of having a new teacher every year the official term is teacher churn negatively impacts some of our most vulnerable students And families know that The numbers at first glance are staggering Hundreds of teachers are leaving annually voluntarily Santelisa says it s a trend that predates when she arrived and she s right Part of what we have to ask ourselves is where are teachers most vulnerable and which teachers are leaving Some of the attrition is good attrition right Some of the attrition is if you are in a profession you think you want to be a teacher you realize it s not for you that s not necessarily a bad thing Santelises arrival in marked at the time the second highest number of teachers leaving the district in the last years One year in and the numbers went from teachers leaving to teachers calling it quits The challenge Santelises says is finding out why so many teachers are leaving and what she can do to stop it That it s usually not one thing It s usually a combination of things And we have incredibly dedicated teachers who work in less than ideal physical circumstances but because of the colleagues they work with because of the professional satisfaction they re receiving the conditions the physical conditions aren t as large as a factor even though they would love for them to change Those physical circumstances have been the last straw in some cases Other teachers claim it s the pay and a few touched on being put in challenging schools without proper resources One thing it is not most teachers we spoke to said was the students We ve always for generations had ails in our community There was drugs alcohol crime Back from great grandparents you know we ve had these issues But when you entered that school building that was just a whole other world And regardless of what was going on in your home you know when you came to school it was a safe haven You were learning But it s the quality of teachers Santelisa says she worries that may leave the district those who resonate with students and leave a lasting impact for the better We could do better We could do better in making sure we re placing our newest teachers not in the most challenging circumstances And other professions don t do that In Baltimore Skyler Henry WMAR News THE STATE HAS A TEACHER ATTRITION PROBLEM IN ADDITION TO KEEPING GOOD TEACHERS AROUND THEY RE HOPING TO CREATE SUPPORTIVE PROFESSIONAL ENVIRONMENTS TO KEEP AS MANY TEACHERS AS POSSIBLE

Our moon A strange thing don t you think Have you ever gazed upon a full moon and wondered wondered how it got there What strange forces could have possibly built it There are many moons within our solar system yet few are as strange as ours No others are known to ring like a bell when struck No others possess such luminosity as our moon In the s Michael Vassin and Alexander Shcherbakov of what was then the Soviet Academy of Sciences created a thesis that the moon is actually the remnants of a very ancient spaceship created by as yet unknown civilization The article was entitled Is the Moon the Creation of Alien Intelligence and was published in Sputnik the Soviet equivalent of Reader s Digest The suggestion of a hollow moon first appeared in science fiction when H G Wells wrote about a hollow moon in his book The First Men in the Moon Michael Vassin and Alexander Shcherbakov s hypothesis is based on the fact that large lunar craters generally assumed to be formed from massive meteor impacts are generally too shallow for scars made upon an organic body and can have flat or even convex bottoms They propose that small meteors are making cup shaped depressions in the rocky surface of the moon while the larger meteors are drilling through a rocky upper layer hitting an armored hull underneath Does George Lucas know something we don t It seems he couldn t resist adding just one crater The authors referenced earlier speculations by astrophysicist Iosif Shiklovsky who suggested that the Martian moon Phobos was an artificial satellite and hollow Interestingly Phobos has been claimed to appear to be hollow by numerous astronomers who have stated that it appears to have an opening on one side making it in a sense similar in shape to an empty shell Phobos s orbit is also a complete mystery Many who have researched it claim that it should have crashed into the surface of Mars many moons ago Between and seismometers installed on our moon by the Apollo missions recorded strange moonquakes The moon was described to have been ringing like a bell during some of those quakes The supportive evidence was then brought to popular attention in March in an article in Popular Science When Apollo deliberately crashed the ascent stage of its lunar module into the moon s surface it was claimed that the moon rang like a bell for an hour leading to arguments that it must be hollow Several YouTubers most notably Crow have supposedly recorded what is now known as lunar waves if confirmed to exist This may prove there is some form of functioning shield or scanning system being seen working on its surface The fact that the Moon is less dense than the Earth is also strong supportive evidence that it is indeed hollow you

plight of gays under the Sharia is killing people And so of course attack me but where is the condemnation of the actual statements that these high profile Muslims are making We don t hear that at all I think it s very interesting and it speaks volumes as to the motive behind the misdemeanor I will say there s been plenty of condemnation of Mahmoud Ahmadinejad and for statements that he has said perhaps after more conversation we will be able to echo the tone at the top as a voice to those that are lacking a voice Thank you What great stories are you talking about Listen listen We had a very productive constructive meeting We made history today because we had meaningful dialogue with Mr Donald Trump and we voiced concerns that were sensitive to the African American community And we asked minds about him And they find out that he s not the person that the media has depicted him to be Are you endorsing that I support Donald Trump and everybody knows that percent Everybody knows that Yes Yes Yes Did you identify yourself Dr Darrell Scott New Spirit Revival Center Cleveland Heights Ohio Why did you ministers not want to endorse today That was the confusing part Some ministers were meeting him today for the first time They want to hear his voice They re going to pray to God about it as ministers do But nobody in this meeting came out with a negative reaction in any kind of way pastors like you religious leaders signed that letter Ebony Magazine needs to do some responsible journalism They should have called me first Mr Trump did we get a reaction from you on the meeting Mr Trump did we get a reaction from you on the meeting and how it went I thought it was an amazing meeting I thought that I met some fantastic people some of whom I ve known I thought it was an absolutely amazing you know it lasted for two and a half hours We came up with lots of good ideas and lots of future ideas but I thought it was an amazing meeting And how did you address some of the concerns that were raised Well I think we ll be addressing them over the coming months and even over the coming years I mean these are deep seated difficulties that certain communities have and we re going to address them And certainly if I m put in a position where I can do something about him which in this case happens to be president we will be working very very closely with everybody And we re going to be solving a lot of problems Right now you have black youth If you look at African American youth where it s and and percent unemployed you have African American people of different ages where it s double and triple other numbers So we re looking at a lot of different things but this meeting was amazing amazing people We must have had close to people in the room And I just want to thank you I want to thank both of you And in particular I ll tell you what it s been a whole group of people standing behind me You can t see them because we actually didn t think we were going to be having a press conference But we all thought it was such a good meeting we would do that And we have many many endorsements that came out of the meeting Is Black Lives Matter a real movement Is black lives matter Well I don t want to discuss that because you know I felt it and I felt it Black lives are very important White lives are very important And to me all lives are very important Very very important What is your reaction to some of the backlash that some of these leaders have gotten Well I don t think we have backlash I mean I saw love in that room I see love everywhere I go I see tremendous amounts like right now I m getting on a plane I m going to Georgia We re going to have a tremendous crowd in Georgia just like we did in Sarasota We had people on an all time record by double And we re going to have a tremendous crowd I m literally leaving right now In fact because the meeting went so much longer And it went longer only because of the love It didn t go longer for other reasons There were unbelievable solutions I think to problems that we will solve that other people won t be able to solve What were the concerns that were raised Well look the concerns are you look at unemployment You look at African American Katie look at African youth I mean you have percent unemployment There s tremendous concerns and they have a right to be concerned Are you going to Ladies and gentlemen I would like to extend our gratitude to the musicians and the dance company for your wonderful performance This has been a wonderful evening And not only for the music and the dancing it has also been about us the people gathered here English people in the very heart of England There are no people I would rather be among no place I would rather be and no time I would rather be alive Because ever since the terrible events of October when the money markets betrayed us all I have known that the change is coming The human species has never faced such immense possibilities such choices In the lives of great nations there are moments of destiny which have swept aside small men of convention and discovered men of the moment And our host is such a man For him for him the little calculations of little men mean nothing He is a man well suited to the mighty mood that England is now in The only reason I say this now at this moment on this stage is because I have some news Good news I think I m sure our host will forgive me if I use this platform this gathering of friends and like minds to give you his trusted allies an early announcement of a long overdue event I want to tell you good folk first that with the dawn of a new decade I will be setting a new course setting up a new political movement here in the very heart of England and Mr Shelby will be with me shoulder to shoulder It will offer a new conception of politics in which the great character of the British our true character will be reborn Many of you lost fortunes in the recent stock market crash The men of money the capitalists in New York the Jews the money power they run an international system in which the infinite mobility of money its capacity to create financial chaos and panic can bring down any government that dares for one moment to oppose it For generations the efforts of hard working men like you have equipped our competitors against us The cotton mills of India the cotton mills of Asia created with British money but used for the destruction of Lancashire and Yorkshire The usurers of New York the sweated labour of the Orient combining to destroy the iron and steel factories of Warwickshire and Staffordshire These are policies that could not be pursued by British statesmen unless they were mad or the servants of Jewish finance Right words They are the ones who took your money But it is I and those who know this truth who will light a flame the atheists cannot extinguish The ranks of our heroes of the Great War have been betrayed again and again by politicians But hear this Those of you who fought the due war for nothing you brave men you will join hands with the angry youth of Birmingham and Manchester and London and Liverpool and declare that England lives tonight and marches on I say all this to you now because I believe it is in places like this with people like you that we will have to pass on our message directly Our message can be summarised with these words Britain first And because this is our message I doubt it ll be reported fairly in the press I m afraid the newspapers of this country are owned by the same vested interests who took your money They sell to the people false news to raise the interests of the faction and the section above the interests of the nation Good man So hear my words and pass them on to those with ears to hear And be reminded that when the new decade begins there will be the birth of a new political party which will speak for you This party this new movement this revolution will be called the British Union of Fascists Yeah Good man Good man

Hey people this is a story of how I learned to cure my coon dog from COVID And so a coon dog is a dog that ll he ll run up a coon up the wrong tree And the wrong tree is a tree that that coon doesn t have a hole in so he can t hide and so these dogs is trained to run out in the woods and tree a coon and and sound off and then the hunter will come and shoot that coon down and uh and it make coon skin hats and and if you ever eat a coon you you ll know the real reason why they like the coon it s like the best roast beef you ever had So it s been going on for a long time and most your old coon hunters you know they weren t real highly educated So years ago I was living in old River Shanty and a girl across the river brought me this big beautiful black puppy It looked to be like a black lab but we knew the parents and it was actually a Rhodesian Ridgeback and Coyote mix And I had spent a lot of time with that dog training it I wasn t a coon hunter but I was teaching him party tricks and it was the most obedient dog Everybody in town knew that dog Anywhere I went the kids would run up and they all knew his name I didn t know how but everybody knew my dog And so he was about nine months to a year and he had hacked and coughed a couple times during training So I brought it to the vet He was a really good dog and he went through all this checkup and she was just loving him and uh took some blood and she came back in later and and and she held my hand and told me that my dog had heartworms and i said how much is this gonna cost so she went to explaining the life cycle of heartworms to me and she explained how the heartworms live in deer out in the field and they draw blood out of that deer and it ll have these microphyllite heartworms little tiny little tiny ones that ll fit up in that syringe and it and it ll bring them and when it went and stuck it in your dog sometimes it lets some of that blood back out and those little microfilic come out And then they go through a life cycle of growing inside your dog And so they breed and so you have many different sizes You know you have the tiny babies and you have them growing You have them growing until they re four or five foot long they ll attach there in the heart like a hookworm and you know the heart will pump that blood and they ll hang back you know the heart pumps that blood to the lungs first so that s why they start hacking they get a little cough and then you know that worm gets so long he s old and starts to break off you know and after that blood goes to the lungs and it pumps through the brain and it goes back through the cycle and and they dissolve and and come out in the feces and it s a really ugly sight the way she explains it to you and i says yeah but you know what s it going to cost me to cure this and and she squeezed my hand and she said two thousand dollars and uh I was living here on the River Shanty so I kind of shook her hand loose and I told her that me and my dog just aren t that attached She had let me know that they were only in that first second stage They were small still and the price even goes up the bigger they get So I went back home and went next door to the bait shop If you don t know what a bait shop is it s like a bar room on a river Except sometimes they can sell you some worms Might even have some hooks or sinkers there And I was telling the old girl that operates the bait shop about it And she says you know my boyfriend he takes care of all his coon dogs He knows something about that So I was back at my place later on that day And this guy come by He looked about like this except a little meaner and uglier Looked real country And she apparently had told him and he come to talk to me about it And so he told me he says you know we ain t got a whole lot of money you know Country Boys and that coon We don t have a whole lot of cash We take care of our own dogs He says I m going to tell you how we do it It s the same way that the veterinarians do it He says go to the co op and ask them for some cattle warmer this Ivermec injection I don t think they had all the others back then anyway He said get you a bottle of that Ivermec and they ll get you some syringes that go with it And he says get you some in shot while you re there Parvo and give him a couple hundred pound warmer pills and go through the regular routine you know you give them this seven one and give them a week and give them a hundred pound worth of warmer pills however much your dog weighs they ll uh they might if your dog weighs they might give you a and a and uh and you just go through uh you know give it to them and then give them a couple weeks and then do it again And what you re doing is you re killing the big ones and the small ones You know they breed and that time you miss some during the breeding While they re in an egg cycle you miss them so you let them grow up big enough before they have time to breed again and kill them again And that s why you wait that certain amount of time between them and he says the the trick is you don t want to kill all these worms because that heart when they die that heart s going to pump them to the lungs and then they re going to go straight to the brain and they re going to give that dog a stroke and kill it he says the trick is to just kill the smallest ones first he said give them a little bitty Justice League Dark issue number one from DC Comics I know this is late but I literally just got this issue this Wednesday I wanted to do a review on it when it came out but the copies at my local comic book store got damaged and the new shipment literally did not come in until this past Wednesday So yeah I was debating on whether I should review this or not I mean I really liked it and stuff like that but I have other comics I was thinking of doing since they got released this week as well I was thinking maybe Fathom number two Spawn Witchblade or maybe Detective Comics I m not doing them now because I haven t had a chance to read any of them yet But I ll probably do one of these on Monday I m kind of leaning towards Fathom just because it s been a while since I ve reviewed that one I literally reviewed the last issue of Detective Comics just a while ago But I don t know I ll let you guys decide which one of these three you want me to review I was thinking of doing Red Hood and the Outlaws because I ve heard that you know the latest issues like a lot of crazy things went down But again the issues didn t get destroyed instead for some reason the comics got delivered to the wrong store so my local comic book store got some comics from another place and the other place got comics from my local comic book store yeah it s I don t know what the hell is going on I don t blame my local comic book store at all I blame the delivery but it seems like there s always an issue especially with one of the series that i want to read either the comics are destroyed upon delivery or they get shipped to another store so we have to wait another week or two but uh yeah surprisingly even domino got uh got shipped to the wrong place so i can t review domino either uh so we re gonna do justice league dark and then when i get the chance to read one of those uh other three issues we re doing on those on Monday So isn t it kind of funny how the DC animated movies are so freaking good and then the live action is just really terrible I wonder why they don t just get the same people who wrote and direct the animated series to go do one of the live actions I bet it would probably turn out pretty good I know obviously there s a difference between directing a cartoon and directing the live action but I don t know I feel like Zack Snyder is like the wrong person to kind of helm up the DC universe And the less said about Josh Whedon the better But yeah so we start off with Zaytana or Zaytana doing a magic trick and it going wrong She s going to do the classic pull the bunny of the hats and the bunny comes out dead And then a giant almost Cthulhu like beast When I say Cthulhu actually I shouldn t say Cthulhu I should say Lovecraftian like beast Erupts from her hat and starts attacking the audience And then Wonder Woman comes for the save Here s the thing I m not against Wonder Woman being in this but basically the New Justice League Dark Team is kind of helmed by her I don t know if she s going to end up being the leader or if she s just kind of pulling a Batman where she s gathering the team together and then she s going to kind of step aside and let Zaytana lead But I m not the biggest fan of Wonder Woman leading the magic team I get it It s like you know she comes from a land that has magic She uses magical items but I just I really don t associate her with magic not to mention the fact that she already has a team Justice League so I just I hate when like others like I hate when the top three get shoehorned into everything I m not saying she s shoehorned into this but give you know Constantine the the helm again I mean his whole thing is supernatural and magic um I mean she already has her team and I just I don t know I just don t want Matt I just don t really want her to helm this team as well It s just I just I just I don t know I don t like it when Superman Batman or Wonder Woman are going around like leading a bunch of teams Um then again I don t really like when superheroes in general are like spread across so many different series I like when they re kind of contained to their own thing But uh yeah we get we get a fight scene between Wonder Woman and Zatanna against the creature So yeah Zatanna Here s our only thing with Constantine He kind of just shows up and he s asking her if she s got any news and clues and stuff like that on the magic Basically I like this idea for Soran Basically magic is turning against its users And that s I don t know to me that s like a really cool idea And it s with everybody Everybody who s trying to use magic for some reason like the spells and things like that are going against them One of the things it was Constantine killed Zatanna s father by burning him alive with one of the spells Of course he didn t do it on purpose but yeah I like that whole story idea It s really cool We get a little bit more where the Wonder Woman is talking to Detective Chimp in the I forgot what the name of I prompted this piece that someone sent to me I thought I d share it with you It s called Growing Up Few commentaries on this global warming hoax have had greater relevance than this I think I might send it to Al Gore And it says this To all the school kids going on strike for climate change you re the first generation who ve required air conditioning in every classroom You want TV in every room and your classes are all computerised You spend all day and night on electronic devices More than ever you don t walk or ride bikes to school but you arrive in caravans of private cars that choke suburban roads and worsen rush hour traffic You re the biggest consumers of manufactured goods ever and update perfectly good expensive luxury items to stay trendy Your entertainment comes from electric devices Furthermore the people driving your protests are the same people who insist on artificially inflating the population growth through immigration which increases the need for energy manufacturing and transport The more people we have the more forest and bushland we clear the more of the environment that s destroyed How about this Tell your teachers to switch off the aircon walk or ride to school switch off your devices and read a book make a sandwich instead of buying manufactured fast food No none of this will happen because the piece says you re selfish badly educated virtue signalling little turds inspired by the adults around you who crave a feeling of having a noble cause while they indulge themselves in Western luxury an unprecedented quality of life The piece ends by saying wake up grow up and shut up until you re sure of the facts before protesting

The more I argued with them the better I came to know their dialectic First they counted on the stupidity of their adversary and then when there was no other way out they themselves simply played stupid If all this didn t help they pretended not to understand or if challenged they changed the subject in a hurry quoted platitudes which if you accepted them they immediately related to entirely different matters and then if again attacked gave ground and pretended not to know exactly what you were talking about Whenever you tried to attack one of these apostles your hand closed on a jelly like slime which divided up and poured through your fingers but in the next moment collected again But if you really struck one of these fellows so telling a blow that observed by the audience he couldn t help but agree and if you believed that this had taken you at least one step forward your amazement was great the next day It had not the slightest recollection of the day before He rattled off the same old nonsense as though nothing at all had happened and if indignantly challenged affected amazement He couldn t remember a thing except that he had proved the correctness of his assertions the previous day Sometimes I stood there thunderstruck I didn t know what to be more amazed at the agility of their tongues or the virtuosity of their lying Gradually I began to hate them

Hi everybody my name is Candice Owens and you are watching my vlog series The Myth of the Coon So foremost why the word coon That is socially unacceptable Why would someone who is African American say the word coon The first answer is because I can The second answer is because it s important that I do To me obviously I believe that the word coon is a myth in the African American community which actually systematically words like Uncle Tom and Coombe these words systematically oppress black people Which is quite ironic when said against the fact that the people that champion these phrases tend to think that they are the core of the black evolvement and the black movement To give you guys a current event a recent example of this in the press is the Colin Kaepernick never ending saga He did not get re signed for the NFL Michael Vick came out not swinging but just essentially said that if he had any advice for Colin it would be for him to get a clean cut and to go back to focusing on playing good football rather than politics Michael Vick was attacked by a bunch of people and he was referred to as an Uncle Tom or a Coon and Colin Kaepernick himself tweeted out a diagnosis for him saying that he had Stockholm Syndrome The insinuation being that he fell in love with his captors he fell in love with the white people and he was grateful to white people which is why he was speaking out against or just giving him suggestions that would ultimately help his career Getting a haircut and showing up to work without causing any drama is generally good advice Colin Kaepernick was performing extremely well in the NFL until he decided that he was suddenly offended by the national anthem I don t think there is a single job in America whether you are white black Spanish regardless of your race that you can show up in and consistently cause drama and you will not eventually just be ousted Particularly with sports people actually participate and go to sports and spend a lot of money and spend for a hot dog to tune out to not be involved in politics to just be involved in the emotion of the sport with you know absent any feelings or political affiliation Bottom line I think that Michael Vick gave Collins some sound advice But once again the black community when they see that they say oh you re not one of us you re one of them We have to stop doing this because we need to evolve We have to understand that showing up everywhere angry or showing up everywhere disappointed is not going to get us anywhere in the world or society that we would like to be There are a lot of things that I believe in personally that would make me either a coon or an Uncle Tom The first of them being that I don t support the Black Lives Matter movement whatsoever because the Black Lives Matter movement does not support me I think that a better title for that movement would be Black Deaths Matter They seem to protest they seem to rage they seem to ruin and they seem to support violence when a black person dies about when a black person lives There are tons of black people that are trying to better themselves and their community There are tons of black people that are disadvantaged by the homes that they are born into and just not having money These groups do not fund them They will pay for somebody s funeral but they will not pay for somebody s college education People that fund these movements like George Soros who has more money than God who has the money to take people straight out of the projects and put them into white communities to fund their education and to fund them living in places that are better than the ones they are born refuses to do so Instead he encourages and he solicits black violence He encourages us screaming in the street about black deaths and he therefore encourages us getting arrested ruining our own records and making it impossible once again for us to thrive in society I think that it is the most hypocritical movement on the planet and absolutely nothing to do with it From a statistical standpoint are black people being gunned down more often than white people Absolutely not The media will try to tell you so because there is more value in black people portraying this stereotype as angry than there is in you actually being educated and understanding the things that our community is actually facing as an enemy One thing that is the biggest problem in the black community is our support which is so ironic when you think about the fact that we continually support these democratic candidates our support of planned parenthood which has actually decreased the black population by Black babies are being slaughtered every single day And yet we stand behind the lines of the people that fund that they fund a black massacre There are no black voices standing up and saying this is wrong And if they do stand up and say it s wrong they re dismissed as an Uncle Tom I m happy to be an Auntie Tom to tell you guys a little bit more about what our community needs to do to better themselves Everything starts and ends with education We cannot better ourselves unless we understand what it is that we are up against Of course systematically black people were oppressed but of course you cannot just stick your hand out and ask for favors to get over that oppression The most recent example of that people that we can look to are Jewish community The Jewish community had the odds stacked against them after World War II They were escaping Germany with the clothes on their back and look at where they are in the world right now They did that by building a community of people that supported one another There is no Jewish phrase for an Uncle Tom When somebody in their community made it and thought differently and made it a little further they encouraged that person And when that person got to the top they hired from the underground of their communities which is something that as black people we have to learn from Absolutely I do not remember the name of the person whose video I watched but he was an African American leader similar to an Al Sharpton He basically acknowledged the fact that no matter what you do for black people if you do not marry a black person then everything you did doesn t count and you are a traitor When people speak to you like this you need to turn off the TV As a black community and as a black person I ve dated within my race I ve dated outside of my race your highest priority as a human being should be to marry someone who thinks like you to marry someone that will bring you the successes that you desire in your own life and to turn off the absolute garbage that tells you differently That is the end of my Candice rant about why I do not support Black Lives Matter Please stay tuned I will be putting out weekly videos I guess the term nowadays is weekly vlogs They will all be entitled The Myth of the Coon Thank you guys so much for listening And they will all be entitled The Myth of the Coon Bye
